msDesc.head: Various papers found at the residence of V. U. Hammershaimb ; Faroe Islands and Denmark

binding.p: The materials were originally kept in a brown paper cover with the title Forskjellige i Provst V. U. Hammershaimbs Bo forefundne ikke ordnede færöske Optegnelser. written in black ink.

condition.p: Only the front cover is preserved, measuring 245 195

note.p: Only the final leaf is preserved.
The letter can be dated to 1894 or slightly afterwards, as Jóannes Patursson mentions the recent birth of his son Páll, who was born in 1894.

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in a single column with 30-32 lines per page.
The paper is lined in pencil.

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in a single column with 22 to 37 lines per page.

additions.p: Various corrections by the main scribe.

msItem.title: Nóa ark
msItem.incipit: Í einum stàði hægst uppi á Kunoy
msItem.explicit: um hann gongur hàgar at leita eftir tí

msItem.title: Býtlingasøgur
msItem.incipit: royður er kominn inn í pollin
msItem.note: Two separate legends from Fámjin, the second of which is labelled number 4.
msItem.bibl: A slightly different version of the legends is found in Hammershaimb: Færøsk Anthologi 384-385

supportDesc.foliation: The leaf is paginated with 166 on p. 11 (f. 6r) and 165 on p. 12 (f. 6v), indicating the current placement of the leaf is in reverse to an original codex.

msItem.title: Contents of Schrøter's ballad manuscript
msItem.filiation: Contains rubrics and text excerpts of the items in NKS 346 8vo

condition.p: The leaf was originally placed between pp. 30-31 (ff. 15v-16r).

msItem.bibl: Partly retold in Jakobsen: Færøske folkesagn og æventyr 34-36

msItem.explicit: harrin han viil gieva okkun baavir

msItem.title: Eg átti mær ein lítlan bát
msItem.incipit: E otte mear ajn lujtlan baad

msItem.title: Floksmenn
msItem.incipit: Hálvdan Úlvsson niðri í húsi, Sjúrður við Kellingará
msItem.explicit: og hevði lagt Føroyjar undir seg, og

origin.p: The informant can likely be identified as Ole Olesen in Hvannasund, which would give a dating of 1853.

msItem.title: Notes on Faroese legends
msItem.note: Contains notes about Rinkusteinarnir, Skógir í Føroyum, Flesjarnar, Skúvoy, Flokksmenn, Nóa ark and Risi og Kelling

origin.p: The orthography used pre-dates Hammershaimb's etymological spelling, meaning the manuscript was likely written during or after his trip in 1841 but prior to 1846.

msItem.title: Turkar í Suðuroy
